post.html:
The website of Statistics Finland was one of my first impression of Finland. As a newcomer with some experience in quantitative research, the official statistics was an important source for me to understand the country. I was impressed that the official statistics in Finland has a good quality of completeness and accessibility in English. While using the Statfin database, I gradually found some touch points which can be improved.

Thatâ€™s why I chose to redesign it when we were asked to hand up a theme for our Information Design coursework at Aalto University. The redesign is an initial attempt and a prototype. More feedback and test is needed to concretize all the ideas.

The core aim of the design is to lower the threshold for transforming cold statistics data into comprehensive information, which should be interactive and visualised. It could be helpful not only for the citizens but also for the government employees who need to make data-based reports. This transformation could be also a basis for more strengthened civil society.

In order to submit it to the open call of showcase session of Visualize Knowledge 2018 conference, I spent more time after the course in bettering the detail of its design. The total period for conducting this project was around 6 weeks.

A glance at the interface after (left) and before (right) the redesign

Showcase

You can visit the webpage designed for the showcase session here. (Unfortunately, the mobile version of this page is not availabe because the webpage was designed for showcasing on high resolution display.)

Report

There is also a report introducing the design in details available on Gitbook.

In this report, a proposal for bettering the Statfin database is demonstrated. The report comprises the following parts:

  • Problem Framing: to illustrate a framework of the problems existing in current online services; to demonstrate on what basis I understand the services provided by Statistics Finland, and how did I conduct my research.
  • Redesign Statfin: the proposal of redesigning the online data bank of Statistics Finland.
  • Limitation and Discussion: to summarize the report by showing the limitation, and providing some insight into the further development.

I was also invited to have an introductory presentation of this work at Statistics Finland, the statistics authority of Finland, in 24th May, 2018.

frontmatter.title: Official Statistics in The Age of Data
frontmatter.description: This is a showcase work at Visualizing Knowledge 2018 Conference, Finland. By redesigning the user interface of Statfin, the offcial statistics database of Finland, the project aims to demonstrate how design could help the citizens interactively visualise the data, and how design could lower the threshold of transforming raw data into useful and conprehensive information.
